reviews.text: The reason for this reservation was my partners birthday. Now I will look for any and every occasion to return. In fact in my taste bud's dreams, we are still there.
reviews.title: In My Dreams, We Haven't Left

reviews.text: When we arrived, we were greeted by a most pleasant hostess. This was the tone of each and every staff member, welcoming and relaxed but never crossing lines that should not be crossed. The new interior decoration is sophisticated and adds to the experience.
reviews.title: A wonderful dining experience
Excellent dinner
reviews.text: But even if one could neither see or hear, the quality of each course ( trust me I ate mine and tasted everything my partner ordered ) will bring us back for any and every occasion we can possibly celebrate. I realize that Groundhogs Day might mean we get to return over and over. Now there's a great idea.

reviews.title: Perfection
reviews.text: My partner had the fava bean soup, and only out of respect for her, did I not steal more every time she turned her head. Also, I was preoccupied by the exactly properly prepared shrimp risotto I had ordered. But nothing could have prepared me for the sublime dover sole and vegetables. Perhaps the finest of any I've ever had. My partner is even more serious about food than I, and she said that it will be difficult not to continue to order her chicken when we next return. Desert was souffle and again praiseworthy.

reviews.title: Happy Hour Great
reviews.text: The wine list was extensive and fairly priced. It included some fine old friends and new to me vineyards about which the sommelier can be trusted .

reviews.title: Wolfgang Puck Restaurant fantastic
reviews.text: The food is excellent. We were going to the ballet and informed the staff and we had a wonderful meal in time to make the curtain. The food is excellent, wine selection fantasic, and an excellent selection of wines. This was our second trip and we are pleased to report everything was perfect. The desserts were also great and you can't beat the ambiance of the renovated hotel with their beautiful swans. It was fitting that the ballett we saw was Swan Lake.

reviews.title: What happened to the Hotel Bel Air???
reviews.text: I will start out by saying I live In LA and did not stay at the hotel. Having said that, I have been a regular of the Hotel for years and heard about the "renovations" and decided to see for myself by having dinner at the new Wolfgang Puck restaurant. So sad. First of all, I understand the interest in going "hip" upscale, modern, and the old girl did need a fresh face lift. But really folks, you cannot take a Hotel W interior design concept and stuff it into a classic Mediterranean facade without it looking just like that....cut and paste ridiculous. It just looks silly when you are sitting in the old alcoves of the Terrace and you see someone has stuck black wood embellishments onto the pink ceiling to make it look more modern. I have nothing against great design or making changes to an existing concept to make it fresh and alive. But this is a mess. Also, judging from the other reviews here, it sounds like it's too much work to stay there as well. When I pay a lot of money to eat and stay in a great hotel, I want to relax...not be required to take a course in electronic devices or look at a plate of food that costs $60 ( the Dover sole) and wonder where the food went? My plate had three pieces of fish the size of 3 double postage stamps with some sauce. Really? for 60 bucks? I hate to say this but the feel of the property on the outside is one thing, then once inside it's something else. That's the major design flaw here. It's like you walk into a green, calm oasis at the gate, and the further in you get, you get slapped in the face with cold, black and brown, contemporary design elements. This isn't Vegas, it's the Bel Air Hotel. Anyway, the staff was very nice the entire evening, but I too detected they are tired of "supporting" these new changes. Most of them were getting the ear full the entire evening. Meanwhile the restaurant was very good. But even for someone like myself, who is more than willing to pay up for great food, I think I should feel properly fed after paying $400-500. I did not. So my love affair with two classics (The Bel Air and Wolfgang) is over for the time being. I suspect in the end they will end up admitting the mistake and start over. Bad interior design pushes people away...modern or otherwise, and it is my experience that no matter how good the food is or how technologically advanced the room lighting is, people don't want to work that hard to feel good in their rooms or leave the restaurant hungry after paying 400 bucks. People will walk with their feet and as far as I could tell, with the restaurant 1/2 full when I left around 9pm, they are.

Had an enjoyable light business lunch on the terrace, excellent place for people watching too (saw 2 celebs dining beside us). Service was top-notch, and atmosphere was sophisticated but not stuffy. Menu is pricey, but your paying for the location/ambiance.
reviews.title: Excellent atmosphere, great food
Christmas dinner at hotel bel air
reviews.text: For $890 for four people, this was the worst dining experience I have ever had. It took 10 minutes to get a bottle of wine after ordered, and another 10 minutes after that for a coke that was ordered for a non-drinker. The lights flashed on and off for the first 20 minutes of the meal due to an electrical problem. On Christmas, the music playing loudly in the now ugly restaurant (charming before redecoration) interior was Taylor Swift. The entres were average and the desert buffet selection outside was poor.

reviews.title: Dinner at the Hotel Bel-Air
reviews.text: After 15 years of Christmas dinners there, never again.

I have never met a more obnoxious hostess who was so nasty and snippy that I am still somewhat shocked. The waiters were not attentive, the food was not memorable and although the restaurant was empty, the staff acted like it was the hottest spot in town. What a joke! Good luck to Wolfgang Puck if this restaurant can work out; we were with a very powerful Hollywood couple (who the hostess didn't recognize and treated without any degree of charm) and the first thing they said when we all left was "We are never coming back. And we're telling everyone we know to skip it."
reviews.title: worst dining experience ever
Restaurant Disappointing
reviews.text: We went to celebrate a birthday at the new Wolfgang Puck restaurant at the recently re-opened Hotel Bel-Air. First, the reservationist said there was only 5:45 pm availability or very late at night. We chose 5:45 pm, and the restaurant was mostly empty last Saturday night until we left around 8 pm. This is one of those restaurants that claims to be booked but really isn't.

The food was very good but most are very small plates, even for main courses. The shrimp and scallops were two or three each at most. The filled pasta (ravioli?) was about 5 or 6. The only one of us who had a decent sized meal ordered the steak.
reviews.title: Excellent food, indifferent service

reviews.text: The service was good but not great. People who sat down after us got served before we did. There should be someone keeping an eye on clients at all times; when a diner looks around the room, the wait staff should immediately appear. And there's enough staff walking around that this should be possible. They are just not looking at the tables!
reviews.title: Great ambiance in a lovely place

reviews.text: The final note was that we were seated outside on a cold night. We inquired about sitting inside and were told by the hostess that the inside restaurant is now for more intimate parties. What does that mean? We were an intimate party of 4. Did she mean that inside dining is reserved for private parties? For couples only? What the heck does that mean? She should have asked if we preferred to sit inside, but she didn't. So if you want to sit inside, make sure you ask about doing so before you get there.
reviews.title: Highly recommend Sunday brunch for gourmet experience & ambiance.
